TopicTitle: [1.12.x] [BG] HabTech2 | Stockalike ISS Parts | 1.0.0 - The Final Update

Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, dave1904 said:

I would recommend removing the shiptype = station from the PMA in future updates. 

If is not OK for you, you can chnage it yourself in the config:

vesselType = Station to vesselType = whatever you want.

1 hour ago, Cheesecake said:

If is not OK for you, you can chnage it yourself in the config:

vesselType = Station to vesselType = whatever you want.

I have changed it but it would be still better for it to be changed in the mod. Its annoying and causes issues when docking because the root part is changed to station type parts if I am not mistaken. There is no reason for the PMA to have a vessel type in my oppinion.

40 minutes ago, dave1904 said:

I have changed it but it would be still better for it to be changed in the mod. Its annoying and causes issues when docking because the root part is changed to station type parts if I am not mistaken. There is no reason for the PMA to have a vessel type in my oppinion.

Since one of the last releases KSP has an option for configure the vessel naming (right-click-menue). So you can use this and there should no problem with docking.

47 minutes ago, Cheesecake said:

Since one of the last releases KSP has an option for configure the vessel naming (right-click-menue). So you can use this and there should no problem with docking.

There is an issue. It has something to do with root parts and station types. It causes the PMA to be the default control point. I do not care if its change or not. I just recommend that the line is removed when/if this mod is updated. There is no point in having an adapter using a vesseltype. If its not changed I dont care. 

Edited February 9, 2021 by dave1904

1 hour ago, dave1904 said:

There is an issue. It has something to do with root parts and station types. It causes the PMA to be the default control point. I do not care if its change or not. I just recommend that the line is removed when/if this mod is updated. There is no point in having an adapter using a vesseltype. If its not changed I dont care. 

That can not be true because the PMA has no control-module. It is only a structureal part. Used this part a few times and had no problems.

2 hours ago, Cheesecake said:

That can not be true because the PMA has no control-module. It is only a structureal part. Used this part a few times and had no problems.

So you're saying I'm making it all up without testing? OK.

So after discussing the drag cube issues (and my failed attempts to generate one) with @ValiZockt, he was so kind to use some magical tool to generate a drag cube for the triple radiator. I tested it in a new save in 1.10.1 and it seems to solve the SSTO problem. Thanks a lot!

Could someone please test it as well and report back if anything unusual happens? The cube below needs to go into "ht2_radiatorTriple.cfg" 

    DRAG_CUBE
    {
        cube = EXTENDED_A, 28.98,0.9633,2.026, 28.98,0.965,1.797, 16.19,0.9554,12.86, 16.19,0.9907,13.01, 1.324,0.7512,7.066, 1.324,0.8827,5.172, 0,6.289,-0.04859, 2.332,12.97,7.007
        cube = EXTENDED_B, 26.83,0.9591,1.331, 26.83,0.9745,1.46, 16.6,0.9868,2.297, 16.6,0.9873,2.428, 3.346,0.7905,12.81, 3.346,0.9789,13.92, 0,0.1109,3.486, 2.332,2.358,13.88
        cube = RETRACTED, 3.113,0.6206,2.036, 3.113,0.6577,1.738, 16,0.9764,1.214, 16,0.99,1.148, 3.678,0.9342,5.827, 3.678,0.9953,1.478, 0,0.04113,0, 2.332,2.219,6.91
    }

So after discussing the drag cube issues (and my failed attempts to generate one) with @ValiZockt, he was so kind to use some magical tool to generate a drag cube for the triple radiator. I tested it in a new save in 1.10.1 and it seems to solve the SSTO problem. Thanks a lot!

Could someone please test it as well and report back if anything unusual happens? The cube below needs to go into "ht2_radiatorTriple.cfg" 


    DRAG_CUBE
    {
        cube = EXTENDED_A, 28.98,0.9633,2.026, 28.98,0.965,1.797, 16.19,0.9554,12.86, 16.19,0.9907,13.01, 1.324,0.7512,7.066, 1.324,0.8827,5.172, 0,6.289,-0.04859, 2.332,12.97,7.007
        cube = EXTENDED_B, 26.83,0.9591,1.331, 26.83,0.9745,1.46, 16.6,0.9868,2.297, 16.6,0.9873,2.428, 3.346,0.7905,12.81, 3.346,0.9789,13.92, 0,0.1109,3.486, 2.332,2.358,13.88
        cube = RETRACTED, 3.113,0.6206,2.036, 3.113,0.6577,1.738, 16,0.9764,1.214, 16,0.99,1.148, 3.678,0.9342,5.827, 3.678,0.9953,1.478, 0,0.04113,0, 2.332,2.219,6.91
    }

 

A little sidenote: KSP does not match the cubes to each animation, hence will only work for the 3rd radiator. I think this is ok for now, as atmospheric-flight-use for this triple radiator is quite limited ;-)

this patch creates it for 1.11 and later, so remove kis.
If you want to use it in previous versions, download it from your preferred platform and do not install the patch.
I did it with good intention
only kis seems obsolete if there is a stock inventory

1 minute ago, Pi_Maaster1337 said:

I did it with good intention

All good, I absolutely see it that way! So thanks a lot, even though I am not the mod maintainer. ;-D

So I tested this under 1.10 and 1.11 with having KIS alongside the inventory patch. It works in both versions with both inventory management systems available. You have both inventories, hence double capacity and KIS items will only go in the KIS inventory. The 1.10 had breaking ground installed, hence you only have the ground science part from stock inventory. They will only go in the stock system.

Most of the items KIS adds are also available in the stock system, e.g. EVA fuel. For attaching and building, I can't really judge how the systems compare, as I have not played the 1.11 yet.

@benjee10The question, that arises is now how a future version should/can look like. I see 3 Options:

  1. I can rewrite the patches so it would select KIS for <=1.10 and stock for >=1.11.
  2. One could also argue to keep both systems to have an upward compatibility, although I am not sure if that is important.
  3. Final option would be to maintain 2 versions: one KIS bases one using stock inventory.

What do you think?
